Text: The day of the Bushin Festival preliminaries...
Match over! The winner is...Claire Kagenou!
Claire never disappoints.

Yeah, well, she has certainly caught the eye of
Princess Iris.
I wonder how far Rose is gonna get...

If only Princess Alexia didn't have to sit this one
out because of her injury.

C'mon, step right up! Put some money on the line and
be somebody!
Aren't you going to bet, Skel?

I put everything I had on that first round cuz I
thought it was a sure win...
Yeah, that was a huge mistake...

Looks like it's bread crusts until the end of the
month for me...
I can give you a few potatoes...

Alright, our next match features a fan favorite! The
world's strongest student council president...
Rose Oriana!!!

Nobody wants to bet on the fourth round? Beat the
odds, and you'll land a huge jackpot with ten
thousand times the winnings!
By the way, how's Cid doing?
Huh, is he even competing?
Now that's just plain mean, Skel...

If you asked someone who the strongest dark knight
was, the answer would've been Iris Midgar two years
ago.

But once she graduated, Midgar Academy for Dark
Knights was left without a champion.
That's what everyone thought.
That is, until one appeared from out of the blue.
//Movie
(My opponent is extremely skilled and very popular.)
(Not a single person is yelling my name.)
(After all that grueling training...)

(I can finally show off the 48 hidden techniques
I've mastered!)
Rose Oriana versus Cid Kagenou!
The ref reads off our names.

Sparks fly between Rose's honey-colored eyes
and my own entirely unremarkable ones.
Let the battle begin!!!
(Rose Oriana... You think you got what it takes?)

(Think you got what it takes to handle...the pinnacle
of side character combat?!)

Rose's sword dances into action the moment the match
begins.

It traces a graceful, sharp arc aiming right for
my chest.

It's an attack no ordinary extra could hope to
counter.
But I can read it like a book.
(Now!)

I remove a packet of blood I had collected the day
before and pop it into my mouth.
It only takes a fraction of a second to complete.

Then, without revealing any motion whatsoever, I jump
backwards with the strength of my toes alone, using
the force of her rapier pressing against my chest to
add some spin.
I fly backwards, whirling round and round...

spraying blood everywhere like a fountain as I
go down.
Gyaaaaaa!!!
(Behold...my Hidden Normie Technique!)
(Spinning Guard, Bloody Tornado!)

(Losing spectacularly to the shoe-in champion
in the first round... That's what it takes to be
a perfect extra!!!)

(It's safe to say everyone in the arena bought my act.
I resist the urge to grin at my perfect performance.)
...The winner is...Rose Ori—
I'm not done yet...!

I get to my feet, acting for all the world like I am
ten seconds away from death.
You gotta be joking if you think this is over...
A-Are you...sure you can really continue?
Referee...
There is still some fight left in him.
Thank you, Rose.
Let's keep going. I still have 47 techniques left.
(How is he able to stand?)

Rose Oriana feels a shiver run through her
at the sight of the boy struggling to his feet.

He's completely covered in blood and looks as if he
can barely lift his sword. He appears to be in no
shape to fight, and in fact, it is a miracle he is
even standing.

Rose's blade may be thin, but it isn't light. And
while it's edge is blunt, the force behind it is
very real.

One solid hit would be enough to put anyone out of
commission.
Hyaah!
Gugyaaagh!!!
...The winner is...Rose Ori—
Not yet...! I can still...fight!!!
Haaah!!!
...Gah!
...Guhurgh!!!
Not...yet!!!
Just how many sword strikes has this boy taken?
Why does he keep forcing himself to his feet?

Though he is clearly past his physical limits,
his eyes tell me he still has the will to fight.
Why... Why take it this far...?
(I've slashed...)
(and slashed him...more than ten times at that.)
(I've put magic into each and every strike...)
(But even after all that...)
(He still says...that he isn't through.)

His fiery gaze says that there is still more
he needs to do.

Indeed, his mind has surpassed his flesh. A body that
is past its limit, propped up by an indomitable spirit.

Rose finds herself impressed with his effort. Just
how important is this match to him anyway?

There has to be a reason why he absolutely refuses
to lose.

The cheering in the arena had died out at some point.
Everyone present is cringing at the sight of the boy.

But Rose is moved by his bravery in putting mind
over matter and facing an opponent he stands
no chance against.

She has a heartfelt respect for this boy Cid Kagenou,
as well as a deep sense of having wronged him.

In that case, the only thing to do is give him
her all.

I apologize for underestimating you at the beginning
of this match.
That's why...
I'm going to end this now!!!
Then just as her blade howls through the air...
Stop!
Wha?!

Deeming that letting things go any further would be
too dangerous, the referee intervenes and stops
the match.
The winner is... Rose Oriana!!!
Rose is showered with applause.
Wait, I can still...!
His eyes burn brightly with the will to fight.
No! This has gone far enough.
Bring the stretcher!
He's bleeding heavily!
Let go of me!
The shock is causing him to struggle!

I won the match...but I was utterly defeated in the
battle of wills.
Cid Kagenou. You have my respect.
